Text: I've had these peculiar tracks from Neverhood stuck in my head for over 10 years, but I never even knew the OST existed. Played through the game recently, and it still amazes me, despite the technical limitations of the mid-90s. Thank you so much for sharing! Will seed this forever :-)

For Mac users i recommend the free converter Max.
http://sbooth.org/Max/
Tinker with the preferences for your desired ouput format and optional iTunes import.
File > Open... - select the cue sheets - Convert!

One last thing: the .cue file for the 2nd CD isn't recognized properly in my audio converter and maybe others. All songs after track 6 are seen as one big udentifiable track. The problem seems to be caused by undefined behaviour of nested single (') and double (") quotes.

Fix: open the .cue file in any text text editor. 
Change the line
    TITLE "Sno, Yell '"Oh!'""
to
    TITLE "Sno, Yell Oh!"
Proceed as usual.
grrr god damit 5 hashfails and what looks like a half-fake torrent, dont bother with this torrent D:

I never thought I would live to see the day, Someone ripping imaginarium .. additionally in lossless! :D Thank you so much athabaska_dick!

Ps. Try ripping to .flac for future releases, It is a free and open lossless codec.

You should use Exact Audio Copy (EAC) software to burn it.
Those Cue and Bin files are not regular disk images.
